results.title: Calcium Channel Blockers and the Risk of Exacerbation in Patients with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease: A Nationwide Study of 48,488 Outpatients
results.text_hl: In the group receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, 2803 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ had an event of severe exacerbation of @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Disease_Chronic_Obstructive @DISEASE_MESH:D029424 @@@COPD@@@ and 59 @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@died@@@; 2862 (67%) had an event within the 12-month follow-up.

citations.NLM: Rastoder E, Sivapalan P, Eklöf J, Achir Alispahic I, Jordan AS, Laursen CB, Vestbo J, Jenkins C, Nielsen R, Bakke P, Fernandez-Romero G, Modin D, Johansen N, Davidovski FS, Biering-Sørensen T, Carlsen J, Jensen JUS. results.title: Association of Amlodipine with the Risk of In-Hospital Death in Patients with COVID-19 and Hypertension: A Reanalysis on 184 COVID-19 Patients with Hypertension
results.text_hl: Univariate and multivariate logistic regressions were used to explore the relationships between mortality and sex, age, comorbidities, smoking, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ status. Out of the 184 @SPECIES_9606 @@@participants@@@, 132 (71.7%) survived and 52 (28.3%) @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@died@@@.

citations.NLM: Loas G, Van de Borne P, Darquennes G, Le Corre P. Association of Amlodipine with the Risk of In-Hospital Death in Patients with COVID-19 and Hypertension: A Reanalysis on 184 COVID-19 Patients with Hypertension Pharmaceuticals (Basel). 2022 Mar 21;15(3):. PMID: 35337177

results.title: In vitro and in silico studies and a systematic literature review of antiglycation properties of amlodipine.
results.text_hl: In addition, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ effectively prevents protein glycation, as evidenced by a reduction in @GENE_APP @GENE_351 @@@amyloid-beta@@@ structure, Amadori products, and @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@advanced glycation end products@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@AGEs@@@).

results.title: Nifedipine and Amlodipine Are Associated With Improved Mortality and Decreased Risk for Intubation and Mechanical Ventilation in Elderly Patients Hospitalized for COVID-19
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@Nifedipine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ Are Associated With Improved @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@Mortality@@@ and Decreased Risk for Intubation and Mechanical Ventilation in Elderly @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ Hospitalized for @DISEASE_COVID_19 @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@COVID-19@@@

results.title: Association between Functional Inhibitors of Acid Sphingomyelinase (FIASMAs) and Reduced Risk of Death in COVID-19 Patients: A Retrospective Cohort Study
results.text_hl: Nonsignificant decreasing OR (0.53, 95% CI: 0.27-1.04; p = 0.064) was reported for FIASMA status. For @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ status, multivariable regression revealed increasing OR of in-hospital @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@deaths@@@ associated with older age (OR 1.04, 95% CI: 1.02-1.07; p = 0.0009), higher prevalence of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ (OR 2.78, 95% CI: 1.33-5.79; p = 0.0062) and higher prevalence of @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@malignant neoplasm@@@ (OR 2.71, 95% CI: 1.23-5.97; p = 0.013), then secondarily decreasing OR of in-hospital @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@ associated with long-term treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (OR 0.24, 95% CI: 0.09-0.62; p = 0.0031).

citations.NLM: Darquennes G, Le Corre P, Le Moine O, Loas G. Association between Functional Inhibitors of Acid Sphingomyelinase (FIASMAs) and Reduced Risk of Death in COVID-19 Patients: A Retrospective Cohort Study Pharmaceuticals (Basel). 2021 Mar 7;14(3):. PMID: 33799977

results.title: Delayed onset of non-cardiogenic pulmonary oedema following amlodipine overdose.
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@, a widely used antihypertensive medication, can cause serious complications in @DISEASE_Drug_Overdose @DISEASE_MESH:D062787 @@@overdose@@@, including @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@, @DISEASE_Bradycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@, @DISEASE_Syncope @DISEASE_MESH:D013575 @@@non-cardiogenic pulmonary oedema@@@ (@DISEASE_Syncope @DISEASE_MESH:D013575 @@@NCPO@@@) and @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@.

results.title: Impact of amlodipine on clinical outcomes for heart failure in patients with dilated cardiomyopathy: a Korean nationwide cohort study
results.text_hl: During the 5-year follow-up period, 6,798 @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@deaths@@@ were reported. @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ had a significantly lower risk of all-cause @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@ than those not receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (32.0 vs. 56.6 per 100,000 person-years, adjusted HR: 0.64, 95% CI: 0.59-0.70, p < 0.001; Table 2 and Figure 2).

citations.NLM: Bae S, Kim WK, You SC, Kim M, Jung IH. Impact of amlodipine on clinical outcomes for heart failure in patients with dilated cardiomyopathy: a Korean nationwide cohort study Front Cardiovasc Med. 2023;10():1305824. PMID: 38045912

results.title: A Portable Reflective Absorbance Spectrophotometric Smartphone Device for the Rapid and Highly Accurate Determination of Amlodipine in Pharmaceutical Formulation and Human Urine Samples.
results.text_hl: The immediate analysis of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ in the @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ urine of the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who suffered severe side effects of this drug is very important for the diagnosis, treatment, and reduction of the @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@ rate.

results.title: Economic evaluation of olmesartan/amlodipine fixed-dose combination for hypertension treatment in China.
results.text_hl: Probability sensitivity analyses (PSA) and one-way sensitivity analyses were conducted for the main parameters to test the robustness of the model.Results: Compared to @CHEMICAL_olmesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C437965 @@@olmesartan@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ free combination, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Valsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068756 @@@valsartan@@@/@<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ fixed-dose combination, treatment with @CHEMICAL_olmesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C437965 @@@olmesartan@@@/@<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ fixed-dose combination led to fewer CVD events and @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@deaths@@@; resulted in an incremental cost of $-5,439 ($-791.36), $6,530 ($950.09), and $-1,019 ($-148.26) and gained additional QALYs of 0.052, 0.094, and 0.037 per @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@, respectively.

citations.NLM: Ren M, Xuan D, Lu Y, Fu Y, Xuan J. Economic evaluation of olmesartan/amlodipine fixed-dose combination for hypertension treatment in China. J Med Econ. 2020 Apr;23(4):394-400. PMID: 31782677
citations.BibTeX: @article{31782677, title={Economic evaluation of olmesartan/amlodipine fixed-dose combination for hypertension treatment in China.}, author={Ren M and Xuan D and Lu Y and Fu Y and Xuan J}, journal={J Med Econ}, volume={23}, number={4}, pages={394-400}}

results.title: Adverse drug reactions reported to a provincial public health sector pharmacovigilance programme in South Africa.
results.text_hl: Seven @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@deaths@@@ were reported; 3 of these reports of @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@deaths@@@ had confirmed ADRs, and these ADRs were assessed as contributing to the @<m>DISEASE_Death</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@deaths@@@.
